A Structured_text is a portion of an that may have identifiable relations between itself and other portions of the Ee_document. Those relations are a container relationship in which the Structured_text is "contained in" an Ee_document, or a sequential relationship in which the Structured_text may be in a specific sequence of Structured_text within an Ee_document. Structured_text may be composed of other instances of Structured_text or Ee_text as content, in a tree structure. A Structured_text shall be acyclic. The Structured_text should at least provide content at the lowest level of the structure.
This part of ISO 10303 is exchanging the content of a document, not its presentation format.
An example of Structured_text is an extract from an Ee_document in SGML, in which each portion of the Ee_document has a known structure.
Structured_text objects can be chapters, titles, paragraphs, sentences or structured markup.

the content_markup specifies the role of the for the Structured_text. The content_markup identifies the computer interpretable element type of the content. Plain text shall be a string encoded according to clause 7.3.3 of ISO 10303-21. Plain text shall be identified by the following contents of the External_definitiion referenced by content_markup: code is "text markup tag", code_value is "plain text", reference_document is "ISO 10303-210".

the structured_text_content specifies the role of the Structured_text for the Structured_text. There may be one or more entries in the structured_text_content for a particular Structured_text. The structured_text_content need not be provided for the Structured_text.
Structured_text_content would only not be provided if there was no need to specify lower level markup within the current markup or if plain_text_content were provided.

the precedent_structured_text specifies the role of the Structured_text for the Structured_text. This role is appropriate when both Structured_text are helping to compose a higher level Structured_text or are referenced by an . The precedent_structured_text need not be provided for a Structured_text.
Precedent_structured_text is provided to ensure the correct sequencing of text contents.

the plain_text_content specifies the role of the Ee_text for the Structured_text. The plain_text_content need not be provided for the Structured_text.
Plain_text_content would only not be provided if there was a need to specify lower level markup within the current markup.
